file_content.text: Move it, gawkers! Let us through!
Mighty fine ship you've got there. We'll be coming aboard.
If there's one thing I don't like, it's uninvited guests.
Not without an invitation.
In how many pieces?
Cross me, and die.
This doesn't have to come to blows. Stand down.
I don't want a fight.
Captain!
Outlander.... my crew. The best engine-burners in Wild Space.
You could've introduced them sooner.
You let them pick a fight.
Should've known they're with you. The resemblance is uncanny.
I shouldn't be surprised.
You're lucky they weren't disintegrated.
They were about to be toast.
The roguish charm tip you off?
Oh, lighten up already.
This was more fun.
Get up here, you mangy wooluks!
Do I know you?
Can I help you?
Keep staring like that, and you'll be doing it with one eye.
Don't stare at me--or else.
I know, I know. I'm incredibly good-looking.
Admiring my good looks?
Name's Ralo. I served aboard Darth Marr's destroyer. We thought you died with him.
You know who I am, don't you?
You recognize me?
I may as well have.
I feel like I did.
They haven't invented the thing that can kill me.
I don't die easy.
Disappear for five years and the whole galaxy loses faith in you.
Everything has changed.
Some of us aren't so lucky.
Some of us lost more than faith.
Don't expect sympathy from me.
Without you none of us would've gotten off that ship.
Not the whole galaxy. You saved my skin that day.
Let's hope it stays that way. Lot of good people owe you their lives.
Everyone makes mistakes. Mine cost lives. It's not something I forget.
I'll learn from my mistakes.
I didn't have many options. It was a hard decision but the right one.
It was a tough call.
You survived. Stop complaining.
Quit whining.
I hope five years of hibernation was enough time to reflect.
We'll never know, will we?
They think you're a hero, but I know better.
How did you wind up with them?
You're a long way from home.
That's a funny story....
Glad you made it out. Nice to see a familiar face.
Good to see you're alive.
I imagine this is all pretty weird for you.
Never thought I'd be a wall plaque for five years. Life's full of surprises.
This isn't what I expected.
You're telling me.
Ralo! Get in here!
On my way!
Never thought I'd get to say thanks.
Lot of good people died that day. You didn't give us enough time to make the escape pods.
I'm not the only one hiding things.
We share on a need-to-know basis. Koth's crew didn't need knowing.
Do you trust them?
Are they trustworthy?
They seem.... nice?
I like them.... I think.
Leave her out of any loop you want, but I always need to know.
Don't keep secrets from me.
Not how I'd describe them, but they get the job done.
Yes. I wish they bathed more often, but you get used to it.
I didn't want to bother you with mundane details. Next time, I'll bore you to tears.
I need to make contact with my network--alone. Try to stay out of trouble.
Where's Lana?
Excellent question.
My best engineer hasn't come back from a supply run to the Free Zone. It's a dodgy neighborhood, if you catch my drift.
A black market. Rival syndicates disagree over who controls it.
They argue with blasters. I think she's in trouble, but we've got our hands full keeping the Gravestone's reactor stable.
Find another engineer.
This isn't my problem.
Give me a holo of your crewmate and point me to this "Free Zone". I'll handle the rest.
I'll find her.
You were hoping Lana could handle it, but she's gone.
You wanted Lana to go look.
I wouldn't bother you if it wasn't important, but I hate sending you in there alone.
Addendum: I will join you, master.
My engineer's name is Tora. HK has her image in its databanks.
She won't be hard to find. Tora has a... big personality.
She's surlier than a hungry rancor, but she's the best engineer you'll ever meet. Thanks for the help.
And when you're done, find me at these coordinates. I'll introduce you to my people.
Help me find Koth's engineer and we can go together.
Or you could join me now.
Make sure there's food. I haven't eaten in five years.
I expect a proper welcome.
I expect answers. There's already too much I don't know about your "friends."
This better be worth it.
I'll join you... but not now.
The Free Zone sells food. But don't eat the roast gorak.
Your visit will be enlightening, I assure you.
Things are finally looking up. Let's keep it that way. You can handle this.
Approaching Asylum.
Told you we'd make it.
We haven't docked yet.
I should probably figure out how to land this thing....
You're sure that place is safe?
I have concerns about Asylum.
We need allies as much as safety.
I thought you were supposed to be good at this.
Get it together, Koth.
Koth is showing off--ignore him and relax.
There's no way we're keeping the Gravestone low-profile. If Arcann has agents here....
Our arrival won't be a secret.
Asylum might be the only place in Wild Space free of his control.
That shadowport isn't on any chart. It's a haven for refugees fleeing Arcann's forces.
We'll be among friends.
Mostly.
Tell your associates we've arrived.
They knew that days ago.
You want to explain how?
Figures.
If we don't all start trusting each other, we're doomed.
Everyone needs to loosen up.
Trust is a rare commodity these days.
Tell us who your people are--and how they know so much.
Answer the question, Senya.
I think you'd rather hear that from them.
Senya's here to help. That's all we need to know right now.
Leave her alone, Koth.
Why should my opinion matter? I'm only flying the ship....
Demand: Are. We. There. Yet?
